**The Supreme Numinous Treasure Pure Brightness Esoteric Methods**

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Numinous Treasure Pure Brightness Esoteric Methods*
Author unknown, approximately dating to the Southern Song dynasty. One of the scriptures of the Lingming sect. Two fascicles. Base text from *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, Dongxuan Section, Methods Category.

---

### *The Supreme Numinous Treasure Pure Brightness Esoteric Methods, Fascicle One*

#### **Daily Incense-Burning and Ritual Practice**
Each day at the *zi* hour, begin by burning incense. Visualize the Daoist abbey facing west, with the ritual master standing eastward. Strike the teeth thirty-six times, then lower both hands and form the *yin* mudra. Release the mudra, withdraw the hands, and bow once—with each bow, visualize a radiance several *zhang* in diameter illuminating the face. Bow twice more, strike the teeth nine times, and recite the incantation:

*"Dao fragrance, virtue fragrance,
The fragrance of non-action, purity, and spontaneity,
The true fragrance of Numinous Treasure Pure Brightness—
Offered to the Six Sovereigns of the Pure Brightness Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthies,
All Numinous Treasure Lords, Emperor Lords, Heavenly Lords, and Divine Kings.
May the methods I practice swiftly fulfill my heart’s intent.
Above, repay the kindness of sovereign and parents;
Below, relieve the suffering of all beings.
May true *qi* ever fill my body,
And all the hundred spirits be commanded and submit.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by law and command!"*

Upon completing the recitation, inhale *qi* once and swallow it.

---

#### **Talisman for Liberating the Six Kin**
**First Talisman:** To be used on the natal days of parents and the six kin. Inscribe with cinnabar, form the *yin* mudra, and visualize oneself as the Bright King of Filial Dao. Recite the incantation once. The talisman may be either swallowed or worn, while visualizing the Two Emperor Lords holding it and proceeding.

**Second Talisman:** To be used on the day of death for parents and the six kin. Inscribe with cinnabar, form the *mao* mudra, and visualize oneself as the Bright King of Filial Dao. Recite the incantation once, then burn the talisman to ash, mix with clay, and apply to the heart. By this method’s power, the deceased will naturally return to life. While mixing the clay, visualize the Two Emperor Lords holding the talisman to guide the departed.

These two talismans are not limited in number; burn one each day to accumulate merit for the living and the dead. The Two Emperor Lords will hold the talismans to either extend lifespan or deliver the departed—this is the root of filial Dao. Only after achieving merit in this practice may one refine the body’s form.

---

#### **Talisman for Refining the Body’s Form**
Form the *kan* mudra and inscribe with cinnabar. For the first two talismans, on a *jiazi* day, face east, recite the incantation while forming the mudra, and perform the method once each. Inscribe sixty talismans. Consuming one daily will naturally fill the body with true *qi*, granting immortality and the power to command ghosts and spirits. While inscribing, visualize oneself as the Bright King of Filial Dao and the Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, with the Two Emperor Lords standing to the left and right. Only after achieving merit in this may one proceed to the *Lingshu Sanxing* talisman.

---

#### **Talismans for Healing All Illnesses**
For the first two talismans, face north and recite the method once each, maintaining the prior visualization. Roll the talismans into pills, recite the incantation over water, and administer to the afflicted—they will recover. If recovery is not immediate, use the latter two talismans, applying them with focused intent, and the Straight Talisman Emperor Lords will naturally attend. With prolonged practice and many healings, spirits will respond to summons spontaneously.

When reciting the method and inscribing talismans, recite once without interruption. If pausing, recite again without limit to the number. When dispatching a talisman, recite once.

---

#### **Talisman for Binding the Hundred Demons**
For harm caused by altars or temples, face north to inscribe, recite the incantation five times, and draw a mouthful of true *qi* from each of the five directions. Form the Jade Emperor mudra to inscribe. While inscribing, visualize oneself as the Bright King of Filial Dao and the Pure Brightness Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, with the Two Emperor Lords holding the straight talisman and the Four Saints escorting. Exercise caution in its use; do not employ it recklessly. Once this talisman proves efficacious, over time it need not be sent by a person—the Emperor Lords will wield it and proceed of their own accord.

---

#### **Talisman for Pacifying, Summoning, and Commanding**
When inscribing this talisman, recite the incantation and form the Jade Emperor mudra, drawing a mouthful of *qi* from each of the five directions.

**For summoning rain or snow:** Inscribe in cinnabar on an iron plate five *cun* in length and place it where dragons reside. To strike an object, place it atop for seven days, and it will arrive.

Before employing the *Lingshu Sanxing* talisman, adhere to this method. Once proficient in the *Sanxing* talisman, knowledge will come spontaneously. When dispatching a talisman, recite the incantation and draw *qi* from the talisman’s original abbey.

---

#### **The Primordial Net Flying Step Dharma Treasure Register**
On each *jiazi* day, face east, form the Jade Emperor mudra, and gaze toward the Dipper. Draw a mouthful of *qi* from the Northern Dipper, then another from the eastern direction. With eyes closed, inscribe sixty talismans, recite the incantation seven times, and say:

*"Controller of authority, remover of death’s register,
Eastern Ultimate, name inscribed for rebirth.
The treasure register may be worn or consumed,
Its use transcends the soul and spirit.
The numinous gates of heaven open,
Eyes closed, recite the true method.
Beyond the body lies my true self—
This is the pattern for transcending the mundane.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by law and command!"*

Consume one talisman daily with enchanted water; wear the remainder in a blue pouch. On the nights of the Three Primes, Three Assemblies, *gengshen*, and *jiazi*, within a quiet chamber, wear the treasure register inscribed on the *jiazi* day. Form the *mao* mudra with both hands, close the eyes, still the mind, press the tongue to the upper palate, and swallow *qi* once. Perceive a body beyond the body, clad in garments identical to one’s own, standing before you. Ahead lies a star altar, nine *chi* and two *cun* in height, with the sun to the left and moon to the right, the Southern Dipper behind and Northern Dipper before. Flanked by Azure Dragon and White Tiger, fronted and backed by Vermilion Bird and Dark Warrior. Feel a lightness, as if floating, and proceed directly before the altar. Step the *ding* *gang* three times, ascend one tier, and circumambulate the altar to the left, reciting the incantation:

*"The immortal Dao is vast and boundless,
The home of the Primordial Beginning.
I ascend the altar,
Purifying the spirit and transforming thoughts."*

May the Most High bestow upon me the streaming rosy clouds.
The nectar of streaming rosy clouds,
Diffuses *qi* with fragrant radiance.
Having partaken of it,
I may tread the *gang* steps.
The spirit lords of the five viscera,
And the incense officials of the day’s straight hour,
Hearing my secret incantation,
Are each at peace.
Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances.

Upon reciting the incantation, hold the *qi* and enter the earthly gate.
Proceed leftward once more, and recite the incantation:

Supreme Great Luo,
Great Luo of Jade Purity.
The true persons of the Jade Purity Palace who transmit the Dharma,
Hearing my secret incantation,
Deliver my corporeal form.
Take that jade rosy cloud,
To purify my spirit.
Now I tread the *gang* steps,
Journeying to the imperial realm,
To ascend and pay homage to the Jade Emperor.
Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances.

After reciting the incantation, hold the *qi* and enter the heavenly gate, reaching the third tier of the altar.
Upon entering the heavenly gate, as if two immortals, jade lads and jade maidens, incense attendants, and messengers—six in all—appear.
Next, kneel lengthily with eyes closed, as if a divine being, riding a five-colored cloud and clad in Upper Clarity robes, transmits the Jade Emperor’s talisman, its golden script resplendent, calling forth your name.
Then, a lad bearing a jade goblet,
Within which is the nectar of jade rosy clouds.
From the Northern Dipper, a black *qi*;
From the Southern Dipper, a red *qi*;
From the sun, a crimson *qi*;
From the moon, a white radiance;
From the Three Terraces, a five-colored mixed *qi*—
Each flows into the cup.
If you can receive it, bow twice and drink.
Hold the *qi*, release the mudra, and descend the altar.
Recite the two sacred texts,
Ascending into the void as if reaching the heavens,
Flying into the Northern Dipper.
Pass beneath the Three Terraces’ stars,
Treading from the *Kui* star to the *Piao* return.
Enter the Dipper in six steps and exit,
Forming the shape of the Three Terraces,
Then emerge from the Dipper’s mouth.
Circle leftward seventy times, transgressing fire.
Proceed eastward, passing through □□,
Ninety-nine steps to reach the Great Yang,
To pay homage to the ancestral master, the Celestial Emperor.
Then turn right, entering the Western Dipper from the Northern Dipper,
Sixty-four steps to reach the Great Yin,
To pay homage to the ancestral master, the Immortal August Lord.
Turn right and exit,
Then proceed rightward, circling left—
Seven revolutions in all, forming a ring.
This is the realm of primordial color.
Fix your gaze, and behold within the formless realm
All the immortals coming to welcome you.
Thereupon, traverse the ten directions,
Paying homage to the thirty-two Celestial Emperors and the twenty-eight constellations.
Upon seeing each constellation,
Tread the *ding gang* twelve times,
Returning to life within the Dipper’s lodging,
Borrowing the *Ji* constellation’s guiding principle to proceed directly.
Gaze back toward the great *Piao* of the Northern Dipper,
Then circle rightward at the Mountain of Crossing Blades,
Facing south for forty-nine steps to pass,
Re-entering the Palace of the Fire Star.
Passing through the Great Yin,
After thirty-six steps,
Pay homage to the Water Star.
From the water, proceed eastward,
Counting sixty-four steps,
Then turn back, transgressing water.
Borrow the guiding principle to exit the palace,
Passing beside the Great Yin,
Eighty-one steps to complete the Metal Star.
Proceed delicately to the Dipper’s mouth,
Thirty-five steps to enter the Earthly Branch.
From earth, return,
Re-entering the lodgings of Metal, Water, and Wood.
Then gaze directly northward,
Where the golden towers stand majestic—
The abode of the Three Clarities’ Celestial Emperors.
Advance eight steps,
Kneel lengthily and bow twice.
Recite the incantation:

This humble earthbound servant, so-and-so,
By fortunate karmic affinity from past lives,
Has encountered a sagely master,
Who transmitted secret instructions,
Enabling me to pay homage at the celestial gates.
Concentrating the spirit and entering stillness,
The nine *qi* become limpid and bright,
The body beyond the body
Attains flight into the celestial precincts.
I, unworthy, gaze upon the heavens and revere the sagely,
Prostrating myself twice in homage.

Recite another incantation:

Fortunate to receive the mysterious favor,
I have encountered a sagely master.
At midnight, my spirit takes flight,
With wholehearted devotion to pay homage to the Emperor.
Yet this humble servant’s bones are coarse and stubborn,
Difficult to transcend and ascend.
With filial piety and sincerity,
I hope to receive grace.
Through earnest seeking,
I have gained the imperial regard.
May my Dao-heart become steadfast,
My spirit-thoughts pure and clear.
Commanding all spirits,
To fulfill the imperial decree.
I humbly beseech the celestial grace
To grant this servant’s petition.

Bow twice again in prostration,
Then exit the gate.
Behold your original form at the crown of your head.
Recite the incantation:

Serpent-cicada, serpent-cicada,
Shedding and departing the dust.
Now I pay homage to the true,
Ascending to meet the azure clouds.
May the divine beings
Seal and enclose my form.
Lift me away,
By the secret and efficacious instructions.

Suddenly, it enters through the crown of the head—
Only then is the treading of the *gang* complete.
For minor practices,
Three to five steps suffice.
To earnestly seek the method of flight and ascension,
Nothing surpasses this.
Now, the diagrams of the guiding principles for the yellow, white, and black paths
Are appended below.

**Diagram of the Primordial Guiding Principle for Flying Steps**

Here ends the *Upper Scroll of the Most High Numinous Treasure Pure Brightness Secret Methods*
*Lower Scroll of the Most High Numinous Treasure Pure Brightness Secret Methods*
*Upper Scroll of the Numinous Writ*

*Heng ta su qie. Ta* pronounced *ye. Qie* pronounced *jia.*
Thus summoning the four heavenly gates below,
Called the Four Illuminating Merit Officers,
Who oversee the transmission of the numinous writ’s talismans.
Whenever wishing to summon and command spirits,
First close the eyes, face east, and draw *qi* four times,
Form the mudra, and inscribe this talisman.
Only then may you summon the various spirits
And inscribe the spirit-summoning talisman.
All is known.

All pronounced *ju*. *Zhi* pronounced *zhi*. Summons the Eye-Opening Youth.

*Se ni bo di*. *Ni* pronounced *er*. *Bo* pronounced *bi*. *Di* pronounced *ji*. Summons the Ear-Opening Youth.

Whenever wishing to see the forms of spirits or speak with spirits, first close the eyes, draw one mouthful of red *qi* from the south, then one mouthful of black *qi* from the north. Form the mudra and inscribe these two talismans, then swallow them with fragrant water.

*Pi du bi*. *Pi* pronounced *pi*. *Bi* pronounced *pi*. Summons the Crown-Opening Youth.

Whenever wishing to divide the body and wander freely, draw one mouthful of *qi* from the east, inscribe the talisman, and recite the *Ruan Bo* mudra. After inscribing, hold the breath, leap once with the body, and proceed as desired.

*Suo he luo*. *Suo* pronounced *sha*. *He* pronounced *jia*. Summons the Three Hun.

*Po jia*. Summons the Seven Po.

*Bu lu*. *Lu* pronounced *lu*. Summons the Six Bowels.

*Ji bo na*. Summons the Five Viscera.

*Jie li*. Summons the Nine Orifices.

*Tuo mi di ti*. Summons the Four Limbs.

Whenever wishing to shed the mortal coil, first inscribe these six talismans, draw six mouthfuls of blue-green *qi* from the east, form the mudra, inscribe the six talismans, and swallow them. Then the host of spirits will guard and protect, preventing dissipation.

*Li se*. Summons the Heavenly Officials.

*Jiu nan*. *Nan* pronounced *bi*. Summons the Earthly Officials.

*Xi duo*. Summons the Water Officials.

Whenever wishing to summon and inquire, face the Celestial Asterism, draw three mouthfuls of *qi*, form the mudra, recite the incantation, and inscribe the talisman, then place it upon the altar—they will arrive.

*Pi di nu chao*. *Pi* pronounced *pi*. Summons the Four Beasts.

Whenever deploying spirits to distribute *qi*, extend the hand toward the void, form the mudra, recite the incantation, inscribe the talisman, and blow it to the four sides of the body—they will arrive.

*He di*. Summons the Clouds and Thunder.

Whenever praying for rain, face the *Bi* Star, draw one mouthful of *qi*, form the mudra, recite the incantation, inscribe the talisman, and place it where the dragon resides—they will arrive.

*Ye ju zhe ji*. Summons the host of gods of Heaven and Earth.

Whenever setting up an offering to request a summoning, face the Gate of Heaven, the Door of Earth, and the Ghost Gate, drawing one mouthful of *qi* from each, inscribe the talisman, recite the incantation seven times, and burn it—they will arrive.

*San mu*. Summons the gods of the Yang Realm.

*Bo la*. *Bo* pronounced *duo*. Summons the gods of the Yin Realm.

Whenever performing *zhui jian* or *she zhao*, use these. Form the mudra, recite the incantation, and summon to inquire of their whereabouts.

*Xi ni pi ju*. Summons the divine generals of the Northern Dipper’s methods.

Whenever wishing to summon, face the *zi* position and draw seven mouthfuls of *qi*, form the mudra, recite the incantation, and inscribe the talisman.

*Tu shu xi na*. Summons the divine generals of the Southern Dipper’s methods.

Whenever wishing to summon, face the *wu* position and draw six mouthfuls of *qi*, form the mudra, recite the incantation, and inscribe the talisman.

*Ye du yi tan*. Summons the envoys of the Marshal of Pure Clarity.

Whenever summoning to inquire about major matters, face east, draw three mouthfuls of *qi*, form the mudra, recite the incantation, inscribe the talisman, and grasp it.

*Yang qi luo*. Summons the divine kings and emperors of the *Mo Ming*.

Whenever dispatching envoys, use the eight talismans from the upper scroll as required, then summon. Face east, draw nine mouthfuls of *qi*, form the mudra, recite the incantation, inscribe the talisman, and place it beneath the seat.

*Bi di chi lu*. Summons the envoys, record-keepers, scribes, and judges of Pure Clarity.

Whenever summoning to inquire about matters, they will arrive. Face east, draw one mouthful of *qi*, form the mudra, recite the incantation, and place the talisman beneath the seat.

*Ni li pan li*. Summons the spirit officials of Pure Clarity.

Whenever summoning for salvation or healing, face east, draw one mouthful of *qi*, form the mudra, inscribe the talisman, recite the incantation, and burn it.

*Ye ning*. Summons the Six *Ding*.

*Tu [ ] chan luo*. Summons the Six *Jia*.

Whenever pursuing, capturing, or seeking, summon them. To summon the Six *Ding*, press the right nostril with the left hand, draw one mouthful of *qi*, recite the incantation, and inscribe the talisman. To summon the Six *Jia*, press the left nostril with the right hand, draw one mouthful of *qi*, and recite the incantation while inscribing it. Tear the talisman to shreds, and they will arrive.

*Du lu*. *Ke ji hu*. Summons the Spirit of Absorbing Truth.

Whenever breaking altars, felling temples, requesting rain, or driving away thunder, summon them for protection. Inscribe the talisman on blue paper, form the mudra, recite the incantation, draw one mouthful of the spirit’s *qi*, and wear it.

*Xu shu shan po na*. Summons the Three *Jia*.

Whenever performing secret rites of retribution, use them as agents. Face west, draw one mouthful of *qi* from Venus, form the mudra, recite the incantation, and inscribe the talisman. Tear it, and they will arrive.

*Ta mo*. Summons the Mounted Attendant of Perception, the Celestial Strategist.

Whenever summoning the wardens of earthly or celestial prisons, use them. For binding and interrogation, press the tongue against the upper palate, silently recite the incantation while inscribing the talisman, and place it at the site of confinement to bind the spirits.

*Mo [ ] duo*. Summons the Spirit of Interpretation.

Whenever capturing spirits or demons whose speech is unintelligible, summon to question them. When summoning, hold the breath, visualize the lungs as white, exhale *qi*, and with the hand trace the talisman in the air following the *qi*. Form the mudra and silently recite the divine incantation.

*Wang jia [ ]*. *[ ]* is pronounced *huo*.

Summons the Registrar. The Registrar is the Archival Spirit. Whenever verifying or examining official cases, exhale a breath of *qi*, form the mudra, recite the incantation while inscribing the talisman, and burn it to summon them instantly.

*Ci na*. Summons the Celestial Treasury Spirit. Whenever officials or generals request their salaries, form the Jade Emperor’s mudra while summoning, recite the incantation and inscribe the talisman to summon them at once.

*Ji zhe mo*. Summons the Mobile Kitchen. When desiring to abstain from earthly food, summon them. While summoning, form the mudra, recite the incantation, and inscribe a talisman. Swallow it, and the food of the Celestial Kitchen will be delivered.

*Di shan zhe bo li na*. Summons the Celestial Steed Spirit.
*□Bu zhi shi duo*. *Jue* is pronounced *qu*; summons the Heavenly Horse Spirit.
*Na hu an*. *An* is pronounced *an*; summons the Cloud Chariot and Wind Horse. These three talismans enable spirit travel upon summoning. For each, draw a breath of *qi* from the five directions, recite the incantation, form the mudra, and inscribe the talisman. Place it beneath the seat to summon them immediately.

*Lu yong bo*. Summons the Chief Secretarial Officer of the Three Armors. Inscribe the talisman, form the mudra, recite the incantation, and draw a breath of *qi* from the west to inscribe it. Once complete, swallow the talisman. When needed, exhale a breath of *qi*.

*Se xi di*. *Di* is pronounced *ji*; summons the Pure and Luminous Talisman-Bearing Merit Officer of the Three Realms. Use whenever burning documents. While inscribing, draw a breath of *qi* from the east, form the mudra, recite the incantation, and inscribe the talisman. Burn the documents to be dispatched.

*Teng beng qie*. Summons the Mountain-Moving Officer. Use when moving mountains. While inscribing the talisman, draw seven breaths of *qi* from the Northern Dipper, form the mudra, recite the incantation, and inscribe it.

*Fan a bi*. Use when relocating rivers or seas. While inscribing the talisman, hold the breath, recite the incantation seven times, form the mudra, and inscribe it. Cast it into the water, and the currents will shift.

*Ba ye cha*. Summons the Dragon. While summoning, draw nine breaths of *qi* at the hour of *chen*, inscribe the talisman, recite the incantation nine times, and send it to where the dragon resides. Whenever dragons in rivers or seas cause harm, invoke this to restrain them.

*Yu an*. *Yu* is pronounced *she*; summons the Mountain Spirit and local deities. Whenever summoning them for matters, draw three breaths of *qi* from the *gen* direction, inscribe the talisman in the air with the hand, recite the incantation three times, and blow upon it.

*Ye yan*.

*Di zhen mi pan zha*. Summons the Spirit of Gold, Jade, Pearls, and Treasures. Whenever hidden treasures are found, invoke this spirit to guard them. Form the mudra, recite the incantation, and seize it.

*Qi dang mi pan zha*. For matters concerning the Five Peaks, summon the officers of the Five Peaks to employ them. While inscribing the talisman, form the mudra and recite the incantation seven times. To summon the City God, Earth God, *Yinggan*, Local Deities, or *Dian* spirits, use this method. First inscribe the name below, then the talisman. This was once used to summon the Earth God of Nanchang.

*Bi you yan ji*. Summons the Spirit of Bows and Crossbows.

*He ye she ye*. *She* is pronounced *shi*. Summons the Spirit of Sabers and Swords.

*Qian zhi bi*. Summons the Spirit of Spears.

*□ yao wen*. Summons the Spirit of Halberds.

*Wu shi fa luo*. Summons the Spirit of Banners. For dispatching soldiers to various places, executing ghosts and spirits, or secret uses, employ these five talismans. Draw *qi* from the north, form the mudra, recite the incantation, and inscribe them. Once the talismans are complete, burn them with fire, and the soldiers will appear wielding weapons.

*Shu lan*. Summons the Fire Spirit to command burning. Form the mudra with the hand at *yin*, draw seven breaths of *qi* from *wu*, recite the incantation, and inscribe the talisman. Place the talisman into the fire.

*Zhi duo*. Summons the Water Spirit to command flooding. Form the mudra with the hand at *shen*, draw one breath of *qi* from *zi*, recite the incantation, and inscribe the talisman. Place the talisman into the water.

*Di li ci zha*. Summons the Spirit of Medicinal Herbs. Use this to prepare medicine for healing. Form the mudra at *yin*, draw three breaths of *qi* from the east, inscribe the talisman, recite the incantation, and blend it with the medicine.

*Se zhi ye na ye na ye bo*. Summons the Great General of Thunderbolts. To summon the Five Thunders, first invoke this spirit. Form the mudra of the Great Slayer, recite the incantation seven times, inscribe the talisman, and place it where the strike is desired to summon the thunder.

*She ti*. Summons the Spirit of Spears. Invokes Marshal Five, Guo Tian the Great General, to carry out secret methods. Form the mudra of the Great Slayer, recite the incantation seven times, draw *qi* toward the Northern Dipper, inscribe the talisman with the left hand, and blow it into the air.

*Yong sha*. Summons the Officers of Poison and Food.

Nīshān'nà. Summons the Five Thunders. *Jūzhītā*. Summons the Lords of the Eight Trigrams. When preparing to establish an altar to receive the Three Realms, first form the mudra with the middle finger while reciting the incantation, then inscribe this and wear it.

*Lúhūwū*. Summons spirits to act and inquires whether the matter is fitting. Extend the hand toward the void and recite: *Ōm*. They will draw near. Used after divination.

*Rèn ōm dǐnàluó dāo dǐ chànà yún fēng jūnà shě sūlū'nà tánjiā qīngnà*. (Pronounce *shě* as *hán*.) Summons the Five Thunders to strike an object. When summoning, curl the five fingers and press them with the thumb. Form the mudra at *yin*, draw five breaths of the five-colored *qi* from *yin*, inscribe upon paulownia wood, and affix it with a needle where the strike is desired.

*Mílú héyē*. Summons the silent, mute thunder of yin. *Qīngmò*. Summons the Messenger Mo Si. *Xūxū bàn*. Summons the Great Spirit of Blazing Fire. All the above are inscribed upon the Five Thunders talisman in overlapping layers. The mudras and methods of use are as before.

*Jūhēyē*. A secret sword method. Form the Golden Blade mudra and point while blowing the talisman. *Xīdá*. Causes the sword to leap from its scabbard.

**Làiqí.** Causes the sword to return. Perform with the hands while reciting the incantation and inscribing the talisman.
**Mílí.** The sword enters its scabbard. Exhaust the practitioner’s spirit, visualize the talisman’s form, and blow upon the sword to guide it in.
**Suōhē.** Inscribe this to command ghosts and spirits, then take it away.

**Língshū Xiàpiān**
**Guǐmí Xiǎngshàn.** (*Guǐ* pronounced as *guī*, *mí* as *mǐ*, *xiǎng* as *hēng*, *shàn* as *zhāo*.)
Summons the Lord of Solar Essence and Lunar Fluid of the Pure Brightness Abbey, Master of *Qi*-Dissemination.
When summoning, inhale one breath of *qi* from the east and seven breaths from the north. In the void, inscribe the talisman with the right hand’s fingers. Recite the incantation and blow upon the afflicted.
**Duòjiē.** (*Duò* pronounced as *chǐ*.)
Summons the Water Spirit of the Pure Brightness Incantation.
For self-swallowed water, ingested talismans, or healing, draw nine breaths of *qi* from the east and blow into the water. Then visualize a talisman entering the water directly.
**Bìyǎoyào.** (*Bì* and *yǎo* as given.)
Summons the Acupuncture Spirit of the Pure Brightness.
When summoning, take a nine-inch stalk of thatch as the needle and visualize the talisman upon it. Recite the incantation nine times, then needle the painful spot and pierce.
Summons the Sword Spirit.
With the right hand’s middle finger, inscribe a talisman toward the intended direction and blow upon it. Daily, face west, draw one breath of sword-*qi*, and blow it onto the middle finger. This is the *Qi*-Sword of Pure Brightness.
**Piáoxiāo Chìzhě.** (*Piáo* pronounced as *biāo*.)
Summons deceased ancestors. Used in ancestral rites and offerings.

When inscribing talismans, draw *qi* from the *yin* (3rd Earthly Branch) direction at dawn to animate them.

**Níngbiāo.**
Summons the *po*-soul of the deceased. Used to rescue those in critical illness, extending their lifespan for rebirth. At the time of use, face east, draw nine breaths of *qi*, inscribe in cinnabar, and have the afflicted ingest it.

**Tújué Lì.**
(*Tú* as in "disciple," *jué* as in "cave," *lì* as in "middle finger.")
Summons the household spirit.

**Yīngcuì Hāoyīn.**
(*Kūn* script.)
Summons the local earth god.

**Níbiàn Huà.**
Summons the Controller of Destiny. Used in healing illnesses, subduing malevolent spirits, and overseeing life. When inscribing the talisman, hold one breath of *qi* and silently recite the incantation while writing.

**Zǔshān Yāo.**
(*Shān* pronounced as *sǎn*.)
Dispels curses cast by vengeful ghosts. At the time of use, draw one breath of *qi* from the north, inscribe the talisman while summoning and instructing the spirit, then present the talisman to them.

**Kūchǔn Rú.**
Dispels spirits of those killed by violence. For those who have suffered unjust deaths, use this to release them. At the time of use, draw one breath of *qi* from the north, inscribe the talisman while summoning them, and guide them toward rebirth to prevent them from becoming vengeful spirits.

**Hóngxiā.**
Dispels hanging ghosts. For those who died by hanging and have not yet been reborn, recite the incantation once, form the mudra, inscribe the talisman, and affix it.

**Xiāokuài.**
For drowning ghosts, use this talisman to aid their transformation. Recite the incantation once, form the mudra, and inscribe it.

**Yìnquē.**
Dispels illness-causing ghosts. For those suffering from lingering or recurrent afflictions, have the afflicted ingest or wear this talisman. Draw three breaths of *qi* from the east, recite the incantation three times, and inscribe it.

**Lěizuān.**
Dispels poisonous *gu* or flying *gu* toxins. When used, burn the talisman while forming the mudra and reciting the incantation five times.

**Xiànxián.**
Dispels disloyalty.

**Fùyì.**
Dispels flattery and sycophancy.

**Lànjiǎo.**
Dispels greed.
All these are grave harms to rulers and the people. When encountered, inscribe the talisman to summon and transform their hearts, so they may reform and become loyal, incorruptible, and upright. In each case, form the mudra, recite the incantation, face the person, inscribe the talisman with the hand, and blow upon it.

**Wǔkǔn Hèyuè.**
Summons spirits and gods to act. Used in altars and temples to requisition divine soldiers and generals. When inscribing this talisman, press the second joint of the four fingers, recite the incantation five times, and inscribe it.

**Zhuālù Cùlù.**
Dispels unfilial conduct. Such grave offenses against the Great Dao and moral principles warrant execution. Summon the talisman spirit and the sword to execute their spirit at night. This is a method abandoned by royal law; use with utmost caution. When used, face the location, inscribe one talisman, and blow upon it. Press the Jade Emperor’s script, recite the incantation three times.

**Shànchóu.**
Subdues barbarians. Barbarians, who show no parental kindness or filial piety, encroach upon the Central Kingdom. Use this to bewitch them, so they may submit. When used, face the location in jest, inscribe the talisman, and place it along their path. Draw one breath of true *qi* from the Celestial Stem, recite the incantation, and inscribe it.

**Něishāo Kuìpàn.**
(*Shāo* pronounced as *shāo*; *zì* pronounced as *tǔ*.)
Rewards the honest and incorruptible. For those who embody these virtues, use the talisman and blow upon them, and fortune will naturally arrive. Inscribe the talisman while forming the mudra, recite the incantation five times, write five talismans, and blow upon them.

**Báomòu Xīndèng Yǎn.**
Summons drought demons.
**Gǔliáng Wūdān Yìshū Niǔwān.**
(*Chǐ* twenty times.)
When inscribing the talisman, form the mudra, recite the incantation ten times, and burn the talisman.

**Qūxié Gēbào.**
Summons the *Kuígāng*. Used to slay and vanquish demonic forces. Form the mudra, recite the incantation, and inscribe it.

**Fèncuì Tuòxián.**
Dispels harm to others.

**Xuēyī Lìzhū.**
Suppresses rebellion and coercion. Used for self-protection. Recite the incantation five times, form the mudra, inscribe the talisman, and wear it. May also be used for others.

**Duōdá Hōng.**

To dispel *wēn* toxins, send away the old woman, and use it accordingly. When using, take seven breaths of northern *qi*, recite the incantation once, inscribe seven talismans, and burn them at the afflicted household. *Wōmìluō suōhē.* (*Wō* pronounced as *yān.*)

Suppresses the hundred spirits. When using, perform divination to determine the tenth *kǎo*, recite the incantation while forming the mudra, and inscribe the talisman to suppress them. *Ǒng hù [□].*

Summons the spirit of closed breath. When practicing *qi*, if speaking of breath-holding, use it accordingly. At the time of use, rub the nose with the hand, recite the incantation while inscribing, and swallow it. *Wěiyǐn mó.*

Dispels defilement and impurity. Whenever encountering such things—such as doorways and the like—inscribe this talisman and burn it. While inscribing, visualize the talisman engulfing the body in great flames. Form the *yín* mudra, recite the incantation seven times, then burn it. *Dátā.*

Eliminates lustful thoughts. *Dāolì.* Expels lustful demons. If the heart stirs, inscribe *xiàlì* in cinnabar and swallow it to extinguish them. While inscribing, exhale five breaths of *qi*, form the mudra, recite the incantation, and inscribe it.

*Běnxiǎn kuí* ghosts. Dispels corpse worms. *Xīn hē.*

Protects *qi*. If one wishes to refine the body, first inscribe the talisman and swallow it for five days. Recite the incantation seven times, form the *yín* mudra, face east to gather three breaths of *qi*, and blow upon it. *Piāolóng shāonà jǐnjǐn shānà tóngshé jiénà.*

Summons the hundred ghosts of Fengdu. On the sixteenth day of the first month, summon them to admonish and forbid them from harming people. While inscribing, form the mudra at the second joint of the four fingers without pause, then burn the talisman. Once the matter is concluded, use the *suōhē* talisman to send them away.

*Fēnglún huǒchē.* For summoning the guilty ghosts of Fengdu to capture and slay them. When inscribing, recite the incantation seven times, face the Celestial Stem to gather *qi*, and blow upon it. Inscribe the talisman with the hand.

*Dìjū dáhē.* Enters the Heavenly Gate.

*Fēnghuǒ jiāojiā.* Dispels evil within the body.

*Fànyì zhēngxiāo.* Summons the *Tāngāng* Vajra. Used when ascending to the true and entering the Heavenly Gate. When using, first obtain the decree before inscribing to prepare for necessary use.

*Nine beams, transverse owl, bow, vessel, drain, execute, boots, *juǎnjuǎn*, *hē*, cage, *lì*, villain, *hōng*.* After ascending to the true and entering the Heavenly Gate, present this talisman to the *Tāngāng* Vajra. It records the response of the divine officials, lest one enter the Heavenly Pivot unaware of the order.

*Fùzhī zhīnà.* When meeting the recording officials, one must also summon the Rewarding Goodness Judge.

*Dálīnájiā.* Also summons the Punishing Evil Judge.

*Sānmùtuóluó.* Also summons the seventy-four bureau judges of the Heavenly Gate. Once the judges are summoned, present them with the following two talismans.

*Dìlì.* This talisman declares, "My conduct is virtuous."

*Shékāi.* Declares, "The entire household is good and kind."

Upon verification with these two talismans, all judges and recording officials will issue the certificate.

*Yúnmù dìnà.* Summons the matching-talisman officials.

*Veigapodi.* Once the talismans are matched, dispatch them to depart.

Having received the certificate, use this talisman to summon the officials, match them, and then send them off.

*Yipojaduo.* The bearers of the bestowed elixirs and documents arrive first beneath the Four Heavenly Gates.

*Zhiqiluo.* Summons the Heavenly Kings to assemble the certificate for ascending the hall granted by the Supreme Emperor.

*Zhuapizhinatuo.* Summons the couriers of the Heavenly Writs to present the memorial of gratitude.

*Yidiyidi.* Summons the Left and Right Chancellors of the Three Clarities to inquire about the rites of court audience and gratitude.

*Luoyoudinan.* Summons the Jade Maidens who transmit words for the Three Clarities.

*Heheshapuo.* Summons the chief officials.

*Jilinühe.* Summons the deputy officials.

*Wind Wheel Fire Chariot.* When the bestowed elixir arrives, use this talisman to express gratitude.

For all these talismans, from the summoning of the recording officials onward, the incantatory seals are not written—one should know them by oneself.

Here ends the *Lower Scroll of the Supreme Numinous Treasure Pure Brightness Esoteric Methods*.

chunks.translated_text:
**The Supreme Numinous Treasure Pure Brightness Esoteric Methods**

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Numinous Treasure Pure Brightness Esoteric Methods*
Author unknown, approximately dating to the Southern Song dynasty. One of the scriptures of the Lingming sect. Two fascicles. Base text from *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, Dongxuan Section, Methods Category.

---

### *The Supreme Numinous Treasure Pure Brightness Esoteric Methods, Fascicle One*

#### **Daily Incense-Burning and Ritual Practice**
Each day at the *zi* hour, begin by burning incense. Visualize the Daoist abbey facing west, with the ritual master standing eastward. Strike the teeth thirty-six times, then lower both hands and form the *yin* mudra. Release the mudra, withdraw the hands, and bow once—with each bow, visualize a radiance several *zhang* in diameter illuminating the face. Bow twice more, strike the teeth nine times, and recite the incantation:

*"Dao fragrance, virtue fragrance,
The fragrance of non-action, purity, and spontaneity,
The true fragrance of Numinous Treasure Pure Brightness—
Offered to the Six Sovereigns of the Pure Brightness Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthies,
All Numinous Treasure Lords, Emperor Lords, Heavenly Lords, and Divine Kings.
May the methods I practice swiftly fulfill my heart’s intent.
Above, repay the kindness of sovereign and parents;
Below, relieve the suffering of all beings.
May true *qi* ever fill my body,
And all the hundred spirits be commanded and submit.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by law and command!"*

Upon completing the recitation, inhale *qi* once and swallow it.

---

#### **Talisman for Liberating the Six Kin**
**First Talisman:** To be used on the natal days of parents and the six kin. Inscribe with cinnabar, form the *yin* mudra, and visualize oneself as the Bright King of Filial Dao. Recite the incantation once. The talisman may be either swallowed or worn, while visualizing the Two Emperor Lords holding it and proceeding.

**Second Talisman:** To be used on the day of death for parents and the six kin. Inscribe with cinnabar, form the *mao* mudra, and visualize oneself as the Bright King of Filial Dao. Recite the incantation once, then burn the talisman to ash, mix with clay, and apply to the heart. By this method’s power, the deceased will naturally return to life. While mixing the clay, visualize the Two Emperor Lords holding the talisman to guide the departed.

These two talismans are not limited in number; burn one each day to accumulate merit for the living and the dead. The Two Emperor Lords will hold the talismans to either extend lifespan or deliver the departed—this is the root of filial Dao. Only after achieving merit in this practice may one refine the body’s form.

---

#### **Talisman for Refining the Body’s Form**
Form the *kan* mudra and inscribe with cinnabar. For the first two talismans, on a *jiazi* day, face east, recite the incantation while forming the mudra, and perform the method once each. Inscribe sixty talismans. Consuming one daily will naturally fill the body with true *qi*, granting immortality and the power to command ghosts and spirits. While inscribing, visualize oneself as the Bright King of Filial Dao and the Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, with the Two Emperor Lords standing to the left and right. Only after achieving merit in this may one proceed to the *Lingshu Sanxing* talisman.

---

#### **Talismans for Healing All Illnesses**
For the first two talismans, face north and recite the method once each, maintaining the prior visualization. Roll the talismans into pills, recite the incantation over water, and administer to the afflicted—they will recover. If recovery is not immediate, use the latter two talismans, applying them with focused intent, and the Straight Talisman Emperor Lords will naturally attend. With prolonged practice and many healings, spirits will respond to summons spontaneously.

When reciting the method and inscribing talismans, recite once without interruption. If pausing, recite again without limit to the number. When dispatching a talisman, recite once.

---

#### **Talisman for Binding the Hundred Demons**
For harm caused by altars or temples, face north to inscribe, recite the incantation five times, and draw a mouthful of true *qi* from each of the five directions. Form the Jade Emperor mudra to inscribe. While inscribing, visualize oneself as the Bright King of Filial Dao and the Pure Brightness Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, with the Two Emperor Lords holding the straight talisman and the Four Saints escorting. Exercise caution in its use; do not employ it recklessly. Once this talisman proves efficacious, over time it need not be sent by a person—the Emperor Lords will wield it and proceed of their own accord.

---

#### **Talisman for Pacifying, Summoning, and Commanding**
When inscribing this talisman, recite the incantation and form the Jade Emperor mudra, drawing a mouthful of *qi* from each of the five directions.

**For summoning rain or snow:** Inscribe in cinnabar on an iron plate five *cun* in length and place it where dragons reside. To strike an object, place it atop for seven days, and it will arrive.

Before employing the *Lingshu Sanxing* talisman, adhere to this method. Once proficient in the *Sanxing* talisman, knowledge will come spontaneously. When dispatching a talisman, recite the incantation and draw *qi* from the talisman’s original abbey.

---

#### **The Primordial Net Flying Step Dharma Treasure Register**
On each *jiazi* day, face east, form the Jade Emperor mudra, and gaze toward the Dipper. Draw a mouthful of *qi* from the Northern Dipper, then another from the eastern direction. With eyes closed, inscribe sixty talismans, recite the incantation seven times, and say:

*"Controller of authority, remover of death’s register,
Eastern Ultimate, name inscribed for rebirth.
The treasure register may be worn or consumed,
Its use transcends the soul and spirit.
The numinous gates of heaven open,
Eyes closed, recite the true method.
Beyond the body lies my true self—
This is the pattern for transcending the mundane.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by law and command!"*

Consume one talisman daily with enchanted water; wear the remainder in a blue pouch. On the nights of the Three Primes, Three Assemblies, *gengshen*, and *jiazi*, within a quiet chamber, wear the treasure register inscribed on the *jiazi* day. Form the *mao* mudra with both hands, close the eyes, still the mind, press the tongue to the upper palate, and swallow *qi* once. Perceive a body beyond the body, clad in garments identical to one’s own, standing before you. Ahead lies a star altar, nine *chi* and two *cun* in height, with the sun to the left and moon to the right, the Southern Dipper behind and Northern Dipper before. Flanked by Azure Dragon and White Tiger, fronted and backed by Vermilion Bird and Dark Warrior. Feel a lightness, as if floating, and proceed directly before the altar. Step the *ding* *gang* three times, ascend one tier, and circumambulate the altar to the left, reciting the incantation:

*"The immortal Dao is vast and boundless,
The home of the Primordial Beginning.
I ascend the altar,
Purifying the spirit and transforming thoughts."*

May the Most High bestow upon me the streaming rosy clouds.
The nectar of streaming rosy clouds,
Diffuses *qi* with fragrant radiance.
Having partaken of it,
I may tread the *gang* steps.
The spirit lords of the five viscera,
And the incense officials of the day’s straight hour,
Hearing my secret incantation,
Are each at peace.
Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances.

Upon reciting the incantation, hold the *qi* and enter the earthly gate.
Proceed leftward once more, and recite the incantation:

Supreme Great Luo,
